text: Now perhaps you've taken the taxi in order to go to a cafe.
The first thing the waiter is going to ask you is what you want,
and he's going to come up and say to you,
You desire?
How would you say that?
Vous désirez?
You'll notice that the I in desire is pronounced slightly differently
than we pronounce it in English.
We have an I sound, a very clear I in desire.
But in French, it's pronounced I.
So there's sort of an I sound in the desire,
which makes desire, instead of being desire,
as you will occasionally hear from English speakers,
instead of desire, it is of course...
Désiré.
So again, one more time, how would the waiter say you desire?
Vous désirez?
You reply, a coffee please.
You've brought a friend along, and your friend's going to say,
For me, a white wine and a sandwich please.
For me, a white wine and a sandwich please.
Finally, you'll ask how much it is, and say,
It's how much?
C'est combien?
The waiter says, six euros.
Six euros.
Thank you.
Thank you.
